text.p: Investors clamored for the newly-minted shares of Advanced Fibre Communications Inc after its initial public offering, driving the stock up 65 percent on Tuesday.
Advanced Fibre has pioneered devices allowing phone companies to operate smoothly over the incompatible copper wire, fiber optic and coaxioal cable systems.
The stock surged 16 to 41, a feat made even more remarkable by its high price tag, analysts said.
Late last week, the price for shares was raised from an initial range of $15 to $17 to a new range of $21 to $23. And the stock finally priced even higher, at $25 a share.
Other companies that made thier IPO debuts today:
-- Select Software Inc vaulted 33 percent after its IPO, up 4-5/8 to 18-5/8. The Gloucester, England, company provides software to streamline business processes such as customer order handling.

-- Storm Primax Inc shares rose two to 12-1/2. The Sunnyvale, Calif., company makes an "easyPhoto" software that allows consumers and small businesses to store and use photos easily on their personal computers.
-- Film Roman Inc shares were flat at $10. The North Hollywood, Calif., company develops animated television shows including The Simpsons, The Critic, Felix the Cat, Garfield & Friends and The Mask.
